file-selector.size-limit: File size should less than {size} MiB

refresh-remind.title: Outdated version detected
refresh-remind.description: Detect outdated version. Please refresh the page.

task.skip-failed-in-current-stage: Skip failed tasks in current stage
task.run-immediately: Run task immediately | Run tasks immediately

error.scheduled-time-must-be-in-the-future: Scheduled time must be in the future

not-applicable.needs-database-for-saving-temp-data: Needs database {database} for saving temporary data.

online-migration.advice-split-statement-to-single-online-: Advice splitting this statement to single online migration issue.

task.prior-backup-tips: Backup affected data ahead of time

status.waiting-connection: Waiting for available instance connections. The instance connection count has reached the limit set on Bytebase. Last report at {time}.
status.waiting-task: Waiting for another task to finish. Last report at {time}.
status.waiting-max-tasks-per-rollout: Waiting for other tasks to finish. Maximum running tasks limit per rollout has been reached. Last report at {time}.

banner.license-expired: Your license for {plan} has expired on {expireAt}.
banner.license-expires: Your license for {plan} will expires in {days} days on {expireAt}.
banner.trial-expires: Your free trial for {plan} will expire in {days} days on {expireAt}.
banner.trial-expired: Your free trial for {plan} has expired.

confirm-button.can-undo: You can undo this action later.

profile.phone-tips: Be sure to include the country code +1xxxxxx

form.email-tips: The email should be unique, and it cannot be changed after creation.
form.title: Title

groups.workspace-domain-required: Please set a workspace domain first.

members.reset-service-key-alert: This action cannot be undone. The old key will stop working immediately. Are you sure you want to reset this service key?
members.service-key-copied: Service Key copied to clipboard, please keep it in secret.

entra-sync.description: Sync users and groups from Entra ID (formerly Azure AD) to your Bytebase instance.
entra-sync.endpoint-tip: Paste this to the "Tenant URL" field in Entra. Entra will sync users and groups to Bytebase via this endpoint.
entra-sync.secret-token-tip: Paste this to the "Secret Token" field in Entra.
entra-sync.reset-token-warning: You need to update the Entra application provisioning config.

members.revoke-access-alert: Are you sure to revoke access?
members.revoke-allusers-alert: Revoke "@:{'settings.members.all-users'}" will revoke related roles from all other users in your workspace. Are you sure to continue?

im-integration.description: Push direct messages to users for specific issue events. Works with project webhook.

sso.description: Single Sign-On (SSO) is an authentication method that enables users to authenticate with multiple applications and websites via a single set of credentials.

form.redirect-url-description: It will be used to fill in the appropriate field in the identity provider application form.
form.name: Name
form.name-description: The display name to be shown to the users
form.identity-provider-information-descriptio: The information is provided by your identity provider.
form.identity-provider-needed-information: Create your SSO application with the following information.
form.auth-url-description: The link to OAuth login page
form.scopes-description: A space-separated list of scopes to be carried when accessing the Auth URL
form.token-url-description: The API address for obtaining accessToken
form.user-info-url-description: The API address for obtaining user information by accessToken
form.user-information-mapping-description: Maps the field names from user info API to the Bytebase user.
form.identifier-tips: It should be a unique string. And if it is not in email format, it will be spliced with domain.

workspace.only-admin-can-edit: Only workspace admin can update the settings.
workspace.logo-aspect: The suggested logo size should be 5:2 aspect ratio, e.g 100 x 40.

watermark.description: Display watermarks on pages, including username, ID and email.

data-export.description: Allow users to export data in SQL Editor

disallow-signup.description: Users cannot self-service signup and can only be invited by the workspace admin.

require-2fa.enable: Require two-factor authentication for all users
require-2fa.description: Users who do not have two-factor authentication enabled for their personal accounts will be forced to configure.

disallow-password-signin.description: Users cannot sign in with email & password, only SSO is allowed.
disallow-password-signin.require-sso-setup: A functional SSO must be created first, or users won't be able to log in.

external-url.description: The external URL where user visits Bytebase, must start with http:// or https://.

sign-in-frequency.description: Sign-in frequency defines how often users must reauthenticate. Configuration updates require users to sign in again for changes to take effect.

maximum-role-expiration.description: Maximum role expiration is the maximum period a role can be granted to a user, will apply on all project roles expect the project owner.

maximum-sql-result.description: Limit the output SQL query result size.

timeout.description: The maximum time allowed for a query to run in SQL Editor.
timeout.no-time-limit: No time limit for queries when set to 0.

domain-restriction.description: Specify the domain that could be used as the email domain for workspace members.

members-restriction.description: Restrict sign-in to users with email addresses from the specified domains.

password-restriction.min-length: Minimum length for password should no less than {min} characters
password-restriction.require-number: The password must contain at least one number
password-restriction.require-letter: The password must contain at least one letter, regardless of upper case or lower case
password-restriction.require-uppercase-letter: The password must contain at least one upper case letter
password-restriction.require-special-character: The password must contain at least one special character
password-restriction.require-reset-password-for-first-login: Require users reset their password after the 1st time login
password-restriction.password-rotation: Require users reset their password every {day} days

ai-assistant.description: Use AI to assist the database development tasks.

api-key.placeholder: An API Key usually starts with sk-*****

endpoint.description: Supply private deployment of API Endpoint.

model.description: Supply private deployment of model name.

announcement.admin-or-dba-can-edit: Only workspace admin or DBA can update announcement setting.

announcement-text.description: To hide the announcement, leave it empty.

restrict-issue-creation-for-sql-review.title: Disallow issue creation for SQL review with errors
restrict-issue-creation-for-sql-review.description: Once enabled, users are only allowed to create issues if the SQL review does not contain any errors.

database-change-mode.description: Control how users perform database changes

issue-mode.description: Use issue to request, review, rollout, and version database changes, suitable for teams with access control and CI & CD workflow.

sql-editor-mode.description: Use SQL Editor to execute database changes directly, suitable for single-person use or environments that do not require supervision.

database-change-mode.can-be-changed-later: This setting can be changed anytime later.
database-change-mode.default-view-changed-to-sql-editor: The workspace's default view has been changed to SQL Editor.

sensitive-data.remove-semantic-type-tips: Remove the semantic type for this column?
sensitive-data.remove-classification-tips: Remove the classification for this column?

global-rules.description: Use global rule to apply masking in batch, e.g. all columns named as "email" will be masked with the specific semantic type and apply the masking algorithm.

semantic-types.label: Columns having the same semantic type will use the same masking algorithms.

template.description: You can apply built-in semantic types from the template. Built-in template cannot be changed.

error.substitution-length: Substitution should be less than 16 bytes
error.slice-invalid-number: Slice start or end is not a valid number

full-mask.substitution-label: Substitution is the string used to replace the original value, the max length of the string is 16 bytes.

range-mask.label: Range mask will replace the original value from start index to end index (end not included) with the substitution. The index starts from 0.

md5-mask.salt-label: Salt is used to generate a hash from the original value.

inner-outer-mask.inner-label: Inner mask masks the interior part of a string. The prefix and suffix represent the unmasked parts of the data.
inner-outer-mask.outer-label: Outer mask masks the left and right ends of a string. The prefix and suffix represent the masked parts of the data.

classification.upload-label: You can upload classification file with JSON format.
classification.override-desc: Existed classification data will be overridden and affect all projects.

release.new-version-content: The new version {tag} is available now! Please check our docs for installation.

mail-delivery.description: Configuring SMTP information will enable users to receive database reports via email, such as slow query weekly reports.
mail-delivery.updated-tip: Successfully updated the mail delivery setting
mail-delivery.tested-tip: Send successfully, please check the inbox of {address}.

sentence.prior-back-table: Data backup to database {database} and tables {tables}
sentence.prior-back-table-for-line: Data backup to database {database} and table {tables} for DML in line {line}

warning.some-previous-stages-are-not-done: Some previous stages are not done.

toolbar.hashtag: Insert issue's link by id. Type the issue id after the hashtag "#"

advanced-search.search: Input title or id to search

type.title: Change Type
type.description: The database change type for issues

approval.description: Search by the issue approval status
approval.title: Approval Status

database-label.title: Label
database-label.description: Input the "key:value" pair then press Enter

issue.not-allowed-to-operate-unassigned-databa:
Can't {operation} to unassigned databases.
It need to be transferred to a project first.

online.description: Based on gh-ost. For large tables, it can reduce the table lock duration from hours to seconds {link}.

issue.statement-from-sheet-warning: Due to the SQL being oversized, it has been truncated to display, and editing is disabled. You can upload a new SQL file to overwrite it.

batch-transition.not-allowed-tips: Some of selected issues cannot be {operation}

sdl.left-schema-may-change: The schema on the left side may change before the issue is applied.

approval-flow.tooltip: The approvers will review and approve the issue in the order specified in the flow. The issue can only be applied after all steps in the flow have been approved. You can configure a custom approval flow for each risk.
approval-flow.pre-issue-created-tips: After an issue is created, Bytebase will automatically match the corresponding custom approval based on the type and risk level of the issue.

grant-request.all-databases-tip: All current and future databases in this project.

update-statement.current-change-will-apply-to-all-tasks-i: In batch mode, current change will be applied to all tasks.
update-statement.current-change-will-apply-to-all-tasks: Current change will be applied to all tasks.

sql-check.statement-is-too-large: As the current statement size exceeds 2MB, the SQL check will be skipped.

error.you-don-have-privilege-to-edit-this-issu: You don't have privilege to edit this issue
error.you-are-not-allowed-to-perform-this-acti: You are not allowed to perform this action
error.cannot-close-issue-with-running-tasks: Cannot close issue with running tasks

issue.unfinished-resolved-issue-tips: This issue is marked as "Done" but some of its tasks are not executed successfully.

blocking-sessions.description: The sessions that are blocking the current session

blocked-sessions.description: The sessions that are blocked by the current session

issue.this-plan-will-be-converted-to-a-new-iss: This plan will be converted to a new issue

schema-drift-detected.description: The selected database(s) has schema drift. Please make sure the drift is expected and safe to apply.

quick-action.unassigned-db-hint: Newly synced databases start unassigned and must be moved to a project for use.

db.failed-to-sync-schema-for-database-datab: Failed to sync schema for database '{0}'.

catalog.description: Edit and upload the table catalog.

sync.sync-all-tip: Database sync is asynchronous and might take a few seconds to minutes

instance.archived-instances-will-not-be-displayed: Archived instances will not be displayed.
instance.no-read-only-data-source-warn-for-admin-: The instance has not configured read-only connection, please consider adding one.
instance.no-read-only-data-source-warn-for-develo: The instance has not configured read-only connection, please ask your DBA to add one.

host.none-snowflake: e.g. host.docker.internal {'|'} host ip {'|'} local socket

proxy.snowflake: For proxy server, append {'@'}PROXY_HOST and specify PROXY_PORT in the port

console.snowflake: The external console URL managing this instance (e.g. AWS RDS console, your in-house DB instance console)

sentence.outbound-ip-list: If you make use of inbound firewall rules for your database instance, please include the following IP addresses in its allowlist to allow access by Bytebase Cloud.
sentence.create-admin-user: This is the connection user used by Bytebase to perform DDL and DML (non-SELECT) operations.
sentence.create-readonly-user: This is the connection used by Bytebase to perform read-only operations such as SELECT query.
sentence.create-admin-user-non-sql: This is the connection user used by Bytebase to perform write and admin operations.
sentence.create-readonly-user-non-sql: This is the connection used by Bytebase to perform read-only operations.

google-cloud-sql.instance-name-tips: The instance connection name should like project-id:region:instance-name.

mysql.template: Create a service account named {user}, then add it in your Google Cloud SQL as IAM user {user}{'@'}'%'. Grant this user with the needed privileges.

postgresql.template: Create a service account named {user}, then add it in your Google Cloud SQL as IAM user {user}{'@'}project-id.iam. Grant the user with the needed privileges.

mysql.template: Below is an example to create user {user}{'@'}% and grant the user with the needed privileges.

postgresql.template: Below is an example to create user '{user}' and grant the user with the needed privileges.

snowflake.template: Below is an example to create user '{user}' with password {password} for {warehouse} and grant the user with the needed privileges.

mysql.template: Below is an example to create user {user}{'@'}% with password {password} and grant the user with the needed privileges.

clickhouse.template: Below is an example to create user '{user}' with password {password} and grant the user with the needed privileges. First you need to enable ClickHouse SQL-driven workflow {link} and then run the following query to create the user.

postgresql.warn: If the connecting instance is managed by the cloud provider, then SUPERUSER is not available and you should create the user via that provider's admin console. The created user will have provider specific semi-SUPERUSER privileges. You should grant Bytebase privileges with 'GRANT role_name TO bytebase;' for all existing roles, otherwise Bytebase may not access existing databases or tables.
postgresql.template: Below is an example to create user '{user}' with password {password} and grant the user with the needed privileges. If the connecting instance is self-hosted, then you can grant SUPERUSER.

redis.template: Below is an example to create user {user} with password {password} and grant the user with the needed privileges.

instance.type-or-paste-credentials-write-only: Type or paste CREDENTIALS - write only

password-type.password-tip: You can also specify external secret manage endpoint

external-secret-gcp.secret-name-tips: The secret name should be like "projects/project-id/secrets/secret-id".

approle.secret-id-plain-text: Plain text for role secret id
approle.secret-id-environment: Environment name for role secret id
approle.secret-tips: An unwrapped secret id without TTL. You can use plain text, or put it into the environment or local file. {learn_more}

instance.unable-to-connect:
Bytebase is unable to connect the instance. We recommend you to review the connection info again. But it's OK to ignore this warning for now. You can still fix the connection info from the instance detail page after creation.

maximum-connections.description: Limiting connection and resource usage is achieved by setting the maximum number of connections to the instance.

sync-databases.add-database: + Add database, press enter to sumbit

host.title: Host
host.description: Filter by instance host. Please input the value then press the Enter.

port.title: Port
port.description: Filter by instance port. Please input the value then press the Enter.

instance.no-params-yet-add-above: No parameters configured yet. Add parameters using the form above.

access-control.title: Access Control
access-control.disable-copy-data-from-sql-editor: Restrict data copying in SQL Editor (Admins/DBAs allowed)

restrict-admin-connection.disallow: Disallow querying data from the admin data source
restrict-admin-connection.fallback: Allow querying the admin data source if no read-only connection is available

statement-execution.title: Statement execution
statement-execution.disallow-ddl: Disallow running DDL statements in the SQL editor
statement-execution.disallow-dml: Disallow running data-modifying DML statements in the SQL Editor

quick-start.guide: click on the step to try it out

notice.title: Quickstart guide dismissed
notice.desc: You can still bring it back later from the top right menu

password-forget.title: Forgot your password?
password-forget.selfhost: Please contact your Bytebase Admin to reset your password.
password-forget.cloud: Please go to the {link} and reset your password.

password-reset.title: Reset your password
password-reset.content: You need to reset your password according to the password restriction policy.

login-as-another.title: You have logged in as another user
login-as-another.content: We will refirect you to the home page.

auth.token-expired-description: Token has expired, please login again

rollout.name: Rollout Policy
rollout.tip: The policy is applied to issues retroactively.
rollout.info: Tasks can be executed by users with '{permission}' permission or the following roles
rollout.auto-info: If all check pass, the change will be rolled out and executed automatically.

environment-tier.name: Environment Tier
environment-tier.description: The environment will appear differently from other environments.

changelog.select: Schema version is recorded each time a schema change is applied via Bytebase
changelog.no-schema-change: this migration has no schema change
changelog.schema-snapshot-after-change: The schema snapshot recorded after applying this change
changelog.establish-baseline-description: Bytebase will use the current schema as the new baseline. This would reconcile the actual schema state with the recorded schema state in Bytebase and fix the reported schema drift. You should only do this if the current schema does reflect the desired state.
changelog.rollback-tip: Select a specific DDL changelog to rollback.

database.unassign-alert-description: The selected databases will be removed from the project
database.mixed-values-for-label: This selected label have mixed values
database.mixed-label-values-warning: Some of the selected resources have mixed values for the same key
database.batch-action-not-support-alter-schema: Some databases don't support altering schema
database.batch-action-permission-denied: Don't have permission to {action} for databases
database.batch-action-disabled: Can not {action} for the databases from different projects
database.data-export-action-disabled: Can not export data for more than one database
database.incorrect-project-warning: SQL editor can only query databases in projects available to the user. You should first transfer this database into a project.
database.select-databases-from-same-project: Please select databases from the same project

sync-schema.title: Sync Schema
sync-schema.description: Bytebase supports synchronizing a schema to one or multiple target databases. (MySQL, PostgreSQL, Oracle, MSSQL, TiDB only)

message.select-a-target-database-first: Please select a target database first.

sync-schema.synchronize-statements-description: You can further edit the generated DDL statements

database.access-denied: You don't have the permission to access this database.

table.select-tip: Please select a table to start.

database.show-schemaless-databases: Show schemaless databases. (Edit Schema is not applicable for schemaless databases.)

validation.name-pattern-mismatch: Secret name should contain only uppercase letters, digit, or _ (underscore)
validation.name-cannot-start-with-number: Secret name cannot start with number

secret.description: You can use secret in the change script to hide sensitive information, please refer to {guide}

classification.description: Use data classification to manage masking policy for many columns by controlling only a small number of classifications.
classification.sync-from-comment-tip: Once enabled, the classification will sync from the table/column comment. The comment should follow "{format}" format.
classification.sync-from-comment-enable-warning: Classification will change with the DDL and sync from the original comment.
classification.sync-from-comment-disable-warning: Classification won't change with the DDL, you can change it anytime on the database detail page.

database.create-target-database-or-schema-for-bac: Please create the target database or schema for the backup first

delete-confirm-dialog.title: Are you sure to delete?
delete-confirm-dialog.content: This will delete these applied revisions and the database schema will not be changed. This action cannot be undone.

schema-drift-detected.description: The schema is different from the last applied schema. This may cause application errors and should be resolved.

overview.info-slot-content: Bytebase periodically syncs the instance schema. Newly synced databases are first placed here. User should transfer them to the proper application project.

creation.title: Create webhook
creation.desc: Create the corresponding webhook for the {destination} channel receiving the message.

deletion.confirm-title: Delete webhook '{title}' and all its execution history?

webhook.direct-messages-tip: Once enabled, Bytebase will send direct messages to the related users (matched by email). Only support: {events}
webhook.direct-messages-warning: You need to configure {im} to make it work.
webhook.activity-support-direct-message: Support send direct messages to related users

issue-creation.title: Issue creation
issue-creation.label: When new issue has been created

issue-stage-status-change.title: Issue stage status change
issue-stage-status-change.label: When issue's enclosing stage status has changed

issue-task-status-change.title: Issue task status change
issue-task-status-change.label: When issue's enclosing task status has changed

issue-info-change.title: Issue info change
issue-info-change.label: When issue info (e.g. title, description) has changed

issue-comment-creation.title: Issue comment creation
issue-comment-creation.label: When new issue comment has been created

notify-pipeline-rollout.title: Issue rollout needed
notify-pipeline-rollout.label: When the issue is waiting for rollout

settings.update-failed: Failed to update the project setting.

archive.title: Archive project
archive.description: Archived projects will not be displayed.

labels.description: Labels can be attached in the issues for management

force-issue-labels.description: Require at least one label when creating issues.
force-issue-labels.warning: Require at least configured one label

allow-modify-statement.description: Allow users to modify the statement of the issue after creation.

auto-resolve-issue.description: Automatically resolve the issue after all tasks are completed.

enforce-issue-title.description: Enforce issue title to be non-empty and created by user instead of auto generated.

allow-self-approval.description: Allow the issue creator to approve the issue.

auto-enable-backup.description: Automatically enable backup for all data changing issues.

skip-backup-errors.description: Skip backup errors and changing data tasks will continue to run.

postgres-database-tenant-mode.description: The tenant mode for Postgres database. If enable, the issue will be run by the database OWNER. Otherwise, the issue will be run by the instance connection user.

max-retries.self: Maximum retries count for lock timeout
max-retries.description: The maximum retries count for lock timeout when running the task. The default value is 0.

ci-sampling-size.description: The maximum number of databases to sample during CI data validation. When disabled (zero), full validation will be performed.

parallel_tasks_per_rollout.description: Control the number of parallel tasks per rollout. Setting this to zero disables any throttling.

members.description: Project members determine the permission to operate database and issues inside the project. Project Owner, Workspace Admin and Workspace DBA all have full project permissions.
members.cannot-remove-last-owner: Cannot remove the last owner of a project

masking-exemption.revoke-exemption-title: Remove both export and query masking exemptions for {member}?

extra-params.description: Additional parameters for database connection string

sql-editor.table-empty-placeholder: Click Run to execute the query.
sql-editor.only-select-allowed: Only {select} statements are allowed to execute.
sql-editor.enable-ddl-for-environment: You can enable the DDL/DML statement for the environment {environment}.
sql-editor.notify-empty-statement: Please input your SQL statements in the editor
sql-editor.can-not-execute-query: Cannot execute query when loading data.
sql-editor.no-data-source: No queriable data source. Please check the data source query policy on environment or project.

confirm-to-close-unsaved-sheet.title: Close the unsaved sheet?

notify.copy-share-link: The share link was copied to Clipboard.

sql-editor.private-desc: Only you can access this sheet

sql-editor.project-write-desc: Both sheet OWNER and project members can read/write

sql-editor.allow-admin-mode-only: Instance {instance} is accessible in admin mode only.
sql-editor.connection-lost: Connection lost. Will try to reconnect when executing next query.

batch-query.description: Batch query {database} additional databases and {group} database groups under {project}.

select-data-source.tooltip: Will find available data sources with restriction policy, then apply the selection.
select-data-source.not-match: Data source not match, expect {expect} but got {actual}.

batch-export.tooltip: Select at most {max} databases to batch export latest query results

subscription.description: You can upload your Bytebase license to unlock pro/enterprise features.
subscription.request-n-days-trial: Request {days} days trial (no credit card required)
subscription.require-subscription: This feature requires {requiredPlan} subscription, please purchase Bytebase license to unlock it.
subscription.trial-for-plan: You can start a free trial for {plan} with {days} days - no credit card required.
subscription.trial-for-days: You can start a free trial for {days} days - no credit card required.
subscription.upgrade-trial: You can upgrade your free trial to this plan.
subscription.contact-to-upgrade: Contact your Workspace admin to upgrade the plan.

instance-assignment.missing-license-attention: You need to assign license to the instance to enable this feature.

success.title: Successfully updated license
success.description: Premium features in subscription plan unlocked.

failure.title: Failed to update license
failure.description: Please check if your license is valid.

subscription.overuse-warning: {neededPlan} on {currentPlan} will be restricted. Upgrade now to ensure continued access.

overuse-modal.description: You are using features unavailable in the {plan}. Upgrade now to ensure continued access:

sql-review.title: SQL Review
sql-review.description: SQL review policy can define different set of SQL lint rules for the respective environments. It helps teams to adopt SQL best practice and enforce schema consistency across different databases. Whenever you attempt a DDL/DML change or use SQL Editor to query data, the query will be checked against the configured SQL review policy.
sql-review.select-review-label: You can attach an existed SQL review policy to the resource, or {create}.
sql-review.policy-create-failed: Failed to create the review policy.
sql-review.policy-update-failed: Failed to update the review policy.
sql-review.no-permission: Only DBA or Admin has permission to create or update review policy.
sql-review.input-then-press-enter: Input the value then press enter to add

attach-resource.label: You can apply the SQL review policy to environments or projects. The database will use the project-level policy if exists, or fallback to the environment-level policy.
attach-resource.label-environment: The SQL review policy will affect all databases belonging to the selected environment.
attach-resource.label-project: The SQL review policy will affect all databases belonging to the selected project. This will supersede the database environment-level policy.
attach-resource.override-warning: Following resources already bound with other SQL review policies. Click "{button}" will override the config.

basic-info.name: Basic info
basic-info.display-name-label: A display name to help identifying among different review policies.

audit-log.export-tooltip: Must select start time and end time within 30 days

actor.title: Actor
actor.description: Search by the audit log actor

method.title: Method
method.description: Search by the method of audit log

level.title: Level
level.description: Search by the level of audit log

resource.delete-warning: The "{name}" will be deleted. This action cannot be undone.
resource.delete-warning-with-resources: The "{name}" is used by following resources:
resource.delete-warning-retry: Please remove it from these resources then retry again.

resource-id.description: The {resource} ID is a unique identifier. You cannot change it after created.

validation.duplicated: The {resource} ID already exists. Please choose another one.
validation.pattern: The {resource} ID can have lowercase letters, digits, or hyphens. It must start with a lowercase letter and end with a letter or number.
validation.minlength: The {resource} ID is too short. It should have at least 1 character.
validation.overflow: The {resource} ID is too long. It should have less than 64 characters.

use-auth-app.description: Open the two-factor authenticator (TOTP) app on your mobile device to view your authentication code.

use-recovery-code.description: If you are unable to access your mobile device, enter one of your recovery codes to verify your identity.

two-factor.description: Two-factor authentication provides an extra layer of security for member accounts. When signing in, you will be required to enter the security code generated by your Authenticator App.

setup-auth-app.description: Use a phone app like Google Authenticator, Microsoft Authenticator, or Authy to get 2FA codes when prompted during sign-in.

scan-qr-code.description: Use an authenticator app from your phone to scan. If you are unable to scan, {action} instead.

setup-auth-app.verify-code: Verify the code from the app

download-recovery-codes.tips: Keep your recovery codes as safe as your password. We recommend saving them with a password manager such as Lastpass, 1Password, or Keeper.

keep-safe.self: Keep your recovery codes in a safe spot.
keep-safe.description: These codes are the last resort for accessing your account in case you lose your two-factor authentication code. If you cannot find these codes, you will lose access to your account.

setup-steps.recovery-codes-saved: I have saved my recovery codes

recovery-codes.description: Recovery codes can be used to access your account in the event you cannot receive two-factor authentication codes.

disable.description: You are about to disable two-factor authentication for your account. You will no longer be required to enter the security code generated by your Authenticator App when signing in.

your-two-factor-secret.description: Copy the code and enter it in your TOTP app manually.
your-two-factor-secret.copy-succeed: Secret copied to clipboard. Paste it into your app.

messages.2fa-required: Two-factor authentication is required in your workspace. Please enable it before you can continue.
messages.cannot-disable: You cannot disable two-factor authentication because your admin requires it in the workspace.

ai.text-to-sql-placeholder: Use natural language and Bytebase will convert it into SQL

conversation.select-or-create: Select or {create} a conversation to start.

node.description: Only one approval is required on this node when there are multiple approvers.

risk.description: Risk Center defines the risk levels for different database operations under different conditions. And risk levels determine the corresponding custom approval flows.

disallow-approve-reason.some-task-checks-are-still-running: Some task checks are still running

issue-review.issue-creators-cannot-approve-their-own-: Issue creators cannot approve their own issue

field-template.description: You can pre-define the field template, then apply the template during the schema change.

column-type-restriction.description: You can restrict the allowed column types for each database engine.

messages.following-column-types-are-used: Following column types are still used by field template
messages.one-allowed-type-per-line: One allowed data type per line

table-template.description: You can pre-define the table template, then apply the template during the schema change.

form.category-desc: Select an existing category or create a new one

setting.description: Defining custom roles. You may apply them to project members and used in custom approval.

role.title: Title
role.expired-tip: The role might has been expired.

workspace-admin.description: Workspace Admin has all permissions within the workspace.

workspace-dba.description: Workspace DBA has all permissions within the workspace except for managing workspace members.

workspace-member.description: Workspace Member is the most basic role within the workspace.

project-developer.description: All viewer permissions, plus permissions for requesting database changes.

project-releaser.description: All viewer permissions, plus permission for reviewing database change requests for release purposes.

project-viewer.description: Read-only permissions for viewing basic project information, accessing databases, and initiating privilege requests.

condition.description-tips: A condition is a rule that can be configured via an expression. For example, the condition "Environment is prod" will match issues executed in the "prod" environment.

or.description: Any of the following are true...

and.description: All of the following are true...

group.tooltip: A condition group is a collection of conditions connected by operators "And" and "Or".

condition.input-value-press-enter: Input value, press Enter to confirm
condition.add-root-condition-placeholder: Click "Add condition" or "Add condition group" to add condition

error.select-at-least-one-change-to-export: Select at least one change to export
error.you-are-not-allowed-to-perform-this-acti: You are not allowed to perform this action

changelog.select-at-least-one-changelog-below: Select at least one changelog below

messages.files-will-always-be-sorted-and-executed: The files will always be sorted and executed in version order.
messages.cannot-modify-files-after-created: You cannot modify files after the release is created.

release.usage-description: The release is only used in custom GitOps with API integration.

export-data.password-info: Provide a password to encrypt the export file.

table-partition.drop-partition-with-subpartitions-confir: Will also drop all its subpartitions.

purposes.self: What's your main purpose with Bytebase?

workflow.team: Work with teammates, need CI/CD pipeline
workflow.simple: No complex workflow, just need UI tools
